title: How do I delete one of my many email adresses in Thunderbird?
content:
Hi,

I have four email adresses in my Thunderbird and now I would have to delete one of them, but it wasn't as easy as I thought it would be.

I tried right-clicking on the email address I wanted to delete, but it didn't work.

Then I went into settings but found nowhere where it said "delete email adress".

But on the other hand, under "Account actions" on the left side under all email addresses it said "Delete account". The problem here is that there weren't three dots after so I was afraid I would delete my entire Thunderbird if I clicked on this.

Where can I delete just ONE of my four email adresses?

Kind regards Carina

title: "Thunderbird.app is damaged..."
content:
Hi,

I was reasonably up to date on Thunderbird, but just today (March 1) I've started getting this: "Thunderbird.app is damaged and can’t be opened. You should move it to the Trash. This file was downloaded on an unknown date." I'm attaching a screen capture. If I keep hitting "Cancel" about half a dozen times, the little panel stops. But it soon starts up again.

So I updated to 115.8.0 (Mac), but it didn't help. Will I lose my email files if I delete Thunderbird.app and re-install? (I'll make a copy of my Profile in any case.)

Do let me know, as that "?" item in the upper right corner of the panel is less than enlightening.

Thanks!

Peter

title: Date shown on threaded messages in Thunderbird
content: In the overall list of messages in the thunderbird inbox there are some threaded messages. That's OK so far. The problem is that the date shown is the date of the first single message, which started the thread. Any new message coming in does not change that date shown. Therefore I am not aware and cannot see that an additional message is received. How can I change the behavior such as the date of the newest message received will be shown? Thanks for any help Willi

I am unable to read ANY of my old emails, decades back - important ones. Pleeeaase help. ;-(

title: Proteger perfiles con clave en thunderbird para que no se pueda borrar el perfil por error
content: Tengo equipos donde acceden varios usuarios al mismo perfil (ya sea de windows o Linux). En cada equipo está instalado thunderbird con una casilla de correo de uso común del servicio. Ahora, por ejemplo, para un usuario en particular, usando el mismo perfil de winodws o linux, deseo crearle un perfil con clave de acceso que tenga embebido una casilla personal. Eso lo logré iniciando, por ejemplo, en windows, "thunderbird -p". Eso me llevó a la configuración de perfiles, generé uno nuevo, definí la casilla por imap, etc. Estando ya con el perfil abierto le definí una clave maestra para ese perfil, entonces, al iniciar thunderbird, me consulta que perfil quiero usar; puedo acceder a alguno que no tenga clave maestra o al que sí. El tema es que, estando en el administrador de perfiles, por más que el perfil tenga clave maestra, un usuario cualquiera puede borrar un perfil y no le pregunta nada. También puede realizarse esa acción a propósito. No veo seguridad al administrar perfiles. Les consulto: hay alguna forma que NO se pueda borrar el perfil sin seguridad, es decir, que no se pueda borrar alegremente sin ninguna restricción de seguridad? Gracias por vuestro aporte...
creator: hap64

title: Can not resize Thunderbird columns in main view
content:
Just updated to v115.08 and can not resize the columns. When I place the cursor on the right edge of column header, I drag it all the way across the monitor screen and the column header expands partially very slow, then when I release it, it goes back to a mini width and I can't read them message info; all columns except the size and received. Unacceptable as I manage a business and can't see my email info!

Likewise, I can't seem to go back to the older version I had! Granted I turned updates off because the nag screen pops up constantly and is SO annoying. Every minor up date now is considered a damn full version ID and it's just a flat PIA.

As well, this update deleted ALL MY ADD_ONS... seriously!!! I've been using both TB and Ff since they began. What to do now. I don't know what's happened to Mozilla programming, but the nag screens for every little change and now this?!?

HELP!!! Thanks in advance.


Big Thunder

title: quickbooks and thunderbird won't connect
content:
I've been running quickbooks 13 for many years with thunderbird (32) as the email client. I've upgraded to Windows 10 last year. I installed thunderbird 32 bit and for a short while I think it worked (5/2023?). I know have some billing to send and thunderbird doesn't show up as an option in quickbooks. I've looked through the help here and tried the best I could to try the suggestions but it is not working. I'm using the 32 bit version and that is what quickbooks requires. I looked at my old win7 system and it had thunderbird 92 on it and quickbooks still recognized thunderbird via MAPI. I used regedit to try to add MAPI=1 according to one set of instructions and it did not work.

thunderbird 115.8.0 (32-bit) Edition Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 Installed on ‎10/‎13/‎2022 OS build 19045.3324 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19041.1000.0 They motherboard is incompatible with windows 7 before downgrading to version 92 I'd try to ask here. If you need more information, please ask. I may be slow, but I will respond.
creator: Multicsfan
